result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas J Vanbeynen

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:19 PM Defendant Douglas J Vanbeynen in court.  Attorney Benjamin T Van Severen in court for Douglas J Vanbeynen.  Prosecuting attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense filed a motion to dismiss today.  A new date is requested so the parties can argue that motion.  If the motion is denied, the court will proceed with the preliminary hearing at that time.   Defendant waives time limits.
Motion hearing set for 11-22-2022 at 11:30am  (Preliminary hearing will be held if Court denies the defense motion to dismiss)
Motion hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Motion hearing on November 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Douglas J Vanbeynen in court.  Attorney Benjamin T Van Severen in court for Douglas J Vanbeynen.  Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing. 
Bail set at $2,000 recognizance with the conditions that he have no contact with anyone under the age of 18 with the exception of incidental contact, and he is not to use any internet enabled device with the exception of work related use on his work computer owned by OTUS.
Preliminary hearing set for 10-26-2022 at 2:00pm
Initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
